MINUTE 8. -Confidential Annex.( 20th July. 1942 , 5.50 v. nu )THE SECRETARY OF STATE FOR FOREIGN affairs referred to the various public announcements as tothe negotiations which had taken place in regard tothe French Fleet at Alexandria. With the improvementin the situation it was, no doubt, no longer amatter of urgency to consider steps to prevent theships falling into enemy hands. There were, however,one or two features in the situation which he thoughtrequired examination. Thus, he understood that admiral Godfroy still used his wireless. Further,it was by no means certain that Admiral Godfroy*recent attitude had been in conformity with theterms of his agreement-with Admiral Harwood.The War cabinet invited the Secretary of State forForeign Affairs and the First Lordof the Admiralty to examine thesemattersoGreat George Street; S;,W*10
